com.xhive.dom.interfaces
Interface XhiveCatalogIf

All Superinterfaces:
DOMImplementationLS
public interface XhiveCatalogIf
extends DOMImplementationLS

The catalog is a special library for storing schema documents, which are represented by ASModels from the W3C abstract schema specification W3C draft specification. X-Hive/DB supports both DTD and XML Schema models.

A catalog is attached to the root-library, and to every library that has had a call to addLocalCatalog. A lot of the methods on the catalog will look upward to higher level catalogs.

The catalog stores both DTD and XML schema models. These models are used during parsing and validation. When a document is parsed with validation, the schema information for that document is added to the catalog automatically if it is not yet stored in the catalog. XhiveCatalogIf does not contain methods to parse schema, this can be done by using DOMASBuilder, which can be retrieved by using function createASDOMBuilder.

All models are identified by a unique id. DTD models are identified by their PUBLIC id. It is also possible to specify match patterns for system identifiers. XML schema models are identified by their filename.

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1
See Also:
XhiveLibraryIf.getCatalog(), XhiveLibraryIf.PARSER_IGNORE_PUBLIC_ID

Method Detail

setPublicId

void setPublicId(java.lang.String id,
                 ASModel model)
Sets the PUBLIC id value in the catalog of a contained abstract schema.

Parameters:
id - the new PUBLIC id for this ASModel, should be unique within the catalog.
model - the ASModel on which to set the PUBLIC id. The specified ASModel should be in this catalog, if not it will try to set the public id in the catalog where the model resides.
Throws:
XhiveException.NAME_ALREADY_EXISTS - Raised if the new public id is not unique.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 3.0

setSystemId

void setSystemId(java.lang.String id,
                 ASModel model)
Sets the system id value in the catalog of a contained abstract schema.
Note: System ids are not currently used in any catalog actions. They are only used to store the system id under which the original id was loaded.

Parameters:
id - the new system id for this ASModel.
model - the ASModel on which to set the PUBLIC id. The specified ASModel should be in this catalog.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 3.0
See Also:
DocumentType.getSystemId()

setSchemaId

void setSchemaId(java.lang.String fileName,
                 ASModel model)
Sets the filename of an abstract schema of type XML Schema contained by the catalog. The filename should not contain path information.

Parameters:
fileName - the fileName of the schema
model - the ASModel on which to set the schema id. The specified ASModel should be in this catalog.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.1

java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> getIds(java.lang.String schemaType,
                                            boolean includeHigherLevelCatalogs)

includeHigherLevelCatalogs - Whether to look in ancestor catalogs.

ASModel getASModelByPublicId(java.lang.String publicId,
                             boolean includeHigherLevelCatalogs)
Deprecated. use getASModelById(String id, boolean includeHigherLevelCatalogs) instead

Retrieve an abstract schema by its PUBLIC id from this catalog.

Parameters:
publicId - the PUBLIC identifier by which the abstract schema is known in the catalog.
includeHigherLevelCatalogs - when set to false only look in this catalog, when set to true first look in this catalog, then look at higher level catalogs.
Returns:
The abstract schema with the given PUBLIC id, or null if no such abstract schema was found.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.0

addASModel

void addASModel(ASModel model)
Add a an abstract schema to the catalog. After parsing a abstract schema on a catalog, this method need not be called (will be added automatically).

Parameters:
model - a content model that was parsed on this catalog.
Throws:
XhiveException.CATALOG_INCORRECT_VARIABLE - Raised if the passed model is not parsed on this catalog.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 3.0

void removeASModel(ASModel model)
                   throws DOMException
Remove an abstract schema from this catalog (or the catalog where the ASModel actually resides).

Parameters:
model - an abstract schema that is in this catalog.
Throws:
DOMException.NOT_FOUND_ERR - Raised if the abstract schema is not present in the catalog.
DOMException
Since:
X-Hive/DB 3.0

setDefaultASModel

void setDefaultASModel(ASModel model)
This function only applies to DTDs.

Set the default ASModel for this catalog. Setting this model is most useful for situations where all documents in a library adhere to the same DTD.

Currently the default ASModel catalog item is only used for parse actions. With it, you can say what ASModel should be used for parsing when: There is a document type declaration in the document, but it has no public id specified in the document, or the public id in the document cannot be found in the catalog(s). When used, the public id of the resulting document will be set to the public id of the default ASModel.

Currently, the default ASModel in the end is identified by its public id, which means that if you change the catalog in such a way that another ASModel gets the public id of the model you set here, that model will automatically become the default ASModel (and if you remove the ASModel with the public id, the default ASModel will not be set). Default models only apply to DTD default models. For XML Schema default models, use DOMConfiguration parameter schema-location of DOMBuilder.

Parameters:
model - An ASModel of this catalog or a higher level catalog, or null if you want to clear the default ASModel of the catalog.
Throws:
XhiveException.CATALOG_INCORRECT_VARIABLE - in case the ASModel passed is not an ASModel of this catalog or of an ancestor catalog
Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.0

getDefaultASModel

ASModel getDefaultASModel()
This function only applies to DTDs.

Return the default ASModel for this catalog, or null when no default ASModel was set or it was removed. The default ASModel is the DTD that is linked to a document during parsing when there is a document type declaration, but no public id was specified or a model with the given public id could be found in the database.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.0

getASModelByCatalogId

ASModel getASModelByCatalogId(long id)
Return the ASModel with the passed catalog id (which matches the library id of libraries), or null if no model with such an id is available.
(To get all ids, iterate over the ASModels and call getCatalogId)
(This will not get items from higher-level catalogs)

Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.1

getGrammarPool

XhiveGrammarPoolIf getGrammarPool()
Returns the grammarpool related to this catalog. The grammarpool only stores XML Schema grammar.

Returns:
the grammarpool
Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.1

getDocumentsUsingASModel

java.util.Iterator<? extends XhiveDocumentIf> getDocumentsUsingASModel(ASModel model)
Returns an iterator containing all documents using the model. The iterator does not contain documents of higher level libraries or descending libraries that hava a catalog containing a model with the same id.

Parameters:
model - An ASModel of this catalog
Returns:
iterator containing all documents using the model
Throws:
XhiveException.INVALID_INPUT_ERROR - when model is null
Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.1
